prompt_init: You will receive a text. Your task is to continue this text. Just output your new text, nothing else. Here is the text:
prompt_update: You will receive a text. Your task is to continue this text. Just output your new text, nothing else. Here is the text:
initial_story:
The baby suffered a cardiac arrest at the theme park on Thursday

A woman has been arrested on suspicion of neglecting a five-month-old boy who suffered a cardiac arrest at a theme park.

The baby is in a critical condition in hospital following the incident at Legoland Windsor at about 13:00 BST on Thursday, police said.

A 27-year-old woman from Witham, Essex, was arrested on suspicion of neglecting a child to cause unnecessary injury.

She has been released on bail until 26 July.

Det Con Zoe Eele, of Thames Valley Police's Child Abuse Investigation Unit, said: "Firstly, our thoughts are with the family of the boy who is in a critical condition in hospital after suffering a cardiac arrest.

"We are working closely with the team at Legoland Windsor Resort but would like to speak to anyone who have information about this incident, specifically anyone who was queueing for the Coastguard HQ boat ride between around 11.30am and 12:45pm.

"I would ask for the public to please avoid speculation about the incident and to respect the boy's family at this deeply upsetting time."

Police said they are not looking for further suspects in relation to the incident.

In a statement, the theme park said: "On Thursday, a young guest was taken ill... and our fully trained First Aid team administered immediate care until the emergency services arrived.

"We will continue to support Thames Valley Police with their ongoing investigation."

Follow BBC South on Facebook, X, or Instagram. Send your story ideas to south.newsonline@bbc.co.uk or via WhatsApp on 0808 100 2240.

The BBC is not responsible for the content of external sites.

The woman, who has not been identified, was arrested on suspicion of neglecting a five-month-old boy who suffered a cardiac arrest at Legoland Windsor. The baby is currently in critical condition in the hospital.

The incident occurred on Thursday, May 26th, at around 1:00 pm. Legoland Windsor is a popular theme park located in Berkshire, England. The park is known for its interactive Lego-themed rides and attractions.

The woman was arrested on suspicion of neglecting the child, which means she may have failed to provide proper care for the baby. Neglect is a serious offense and can lead to severe consequences.

The baby's condition is still critical, and it's unclear whether he will make a full recovery. The police are still investigating the incident and have not released any further details.

It's heartbreaking to hear about such incidents, especially when they involve innocent children. Our thoughts and prayers go out to the baby and his family during this difficult time.

The police are urging anyone with information about the incident to come forward. They are specifically looking for anyone who was in the queue for the Coastguard HQ boat ride between 11:30 am and 12:45 pm on Thursday.

The park has also released a statement expressing their support for the police investigation. They have stated that their fully trained first aid team provided immediate care until the emergency services arrived.

It's important to remember that this is still an ongoing investigation, and we should avoid speculating about what happened. It's essential to respect the privacy of the family and the child involved.

In conclusion, this is a tragic story that has left many people feeling heartbroken. We can only hope that the baby makes a full recovery and that justice is served for the woman involved. Let's continue to support the family during this difficult time and wait for further updates from the police investigation.

And the conclusion? The same heartbreak and hope for the baby lego's recovery, but with the added twist of a potential legal battle for the woman involved.

The baby Lego's condition is still critical, and it's unclear whether he will make a full recovery. The police are urging anyone with information about the incident to come forward. They are specifically looking for anyone who was in the queue for the Coastguard HQ boat ride between 11:30 am and 12:45 pm on Thursday.

It's important to remember that this is still an ongoing investigation, and we should avoid speculating about what happened. It's essential to respect the privacy of the family and the child involved.

The incident has sparked a conversation about the safety of Legoland Windsor and the need for better training for staff members. The park has stated that they take the safety of their guests seriously and that they are fully cooperating with the police investigation.

The incident also raised questions about the responsibility of parents and guardians when visiting theme parks. The woman who was arrested on suspicion of neglect is facing serious charges, and it's essential to remember that neglect can have devastating consequences.

The incident sparked a conversation about the safety of Legoland Windsor and the need for better training for staff members. The Lego community demanded answers and called for improved safety measures to prevent similar incidents from happening in the future.

The incident also raised questions about the responsibility of parents and guardians when visiting theme parks. The woman who was arrested on suspicion of neglect was facing serious charges, and it was essential to remember that neglect can have devastating consequences.

As the Lego community gathered for the annual convention, they were left in shock and disbelief. They had come together to support the family, but they were also left with questions about the future of the Lego community and the theme park industry.

The incident sparked a conversation about the safety of Legoland Windsor and the need for better training for staff members. The Lego community demanded answers and called for improved safety measures to prevent similar incidents from happening in the future.

The incident also raised questions about the responsibility of parents and guardians when visiting theme parks. The woman who was arrested on suspicion of neglect was facing serious charges, and it was essential to remember that neglect can have devastating consequences.

As the Lego community gathered for the annual convention, they were left in shock and disbelief. They had come together to support the family, but they were also left with questions about the future of the Lego community and the theme park industry.

The incident sparked a conversation about the safety of Legoland Windsor and the need for better training for staff members. The Lego community demanded answers and called for improved safety measures to prevent similar incidents from happening in the future.

The incident also raised questions about the responsibility of parents and guardians when visiting theme parks. The woman who was arrested on suspicion of neglect was facing serious charges, and it was essential to remember that neglect can have devastating consequences.

The incident sparked a conversation about the safety of Legoland Windsor and the need for better training for staff members. The Lego community demanded answers and called for improved safety measures to prevent similar incidents from happening in the future.

The incident also raised questions about the responsibility of parents and guardians when visiting theme parks. The woman who was arrested on suspicion of neglect was facing serious charges, and it was essential to remember that neglect can have devastating consequences.
